comments:
build I20031121

- restart self-hosting workspace
- F11 to launch last target eclipse
- hit it a bunch more times because it seemed to not be responding
- got several errors in the progress view saying there was an error launching, 
but with no further details
- one of the targets ended up actually running
- log has several entries like:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Dec 02, 2003 11:51:43.18
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Launch".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.JavaRuntime.computeUnresolvedSourceLookupPath
(JavaRuntime.java:612)
	at 
org.eclipse.jdt.launching.sourcelookup.JavaSourceLocator.initializeDefaults
(JavaSourceLocator.java:388)
	at org.eclipse.jdt.debug.ui.JavaUISourceLocator.initializeDefaults
(JavaUISourceLocator.java:280)
	at 
org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.initializeSourceLocator
(LaunchConfiguration.java:183)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.core.LaunchConfiguration.launch
(LaunchConfiguration.java:155)
	at org.eclipse.debug.internal.ui.DebugUIPlugin.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUIPlugin.java:739)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools.buildAndLaunch
(DebugUITools.java:625)
	at org.eclipse.debug.ui.DebugUITools$3.run(DebugUITools.java:581)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:62)

The Debug view was also left with a bunch of stale processes (not terminated, 
but with no children).

I almost think this is a problem with the registry. It looks like an extension 
has gone missing (the PDE source lookup path provider). This is similar to bug 
40947.

If you delete your registry does the problem persist?

On the other hand, we do have a potential NPE if source lookup path providers 
change Ids (which should be addressed).

Fixed NPE. An exception is now thrown (as per spec) when a source path provider 
or classpath provider referenced, does not exist. The fact that the provider 
did not exist is a different problem (see bug 40947).
Please verify, Darin (S). Changes in JavaRuntime.
